title: The misunderstanding brewing between Macron and Barnier
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron had preferred Michel Barnier to other contenders for the role of prime minister, with the assurance that he would not question his economic policy.

title: 'Family destroyed': Children of French rape victim speak of heartbreak
summary: The daughter and sons of Dominique and Gisèle Pelicot spoke in court in the southern city of Avignon as the trial entered its final stages

title: Kremlin accuses Biden of 'fueling the fire' in Ukraine ahead of Trump's return to the White House
summary: On Monday, the Kremlin vowed a 'response' if Ukraine fires US missiles into Russia. A US official told Agence France-Presse (AFP) on Sunday that Biden had cleared Kyiv to use long-range American missiles against military targets inside Russia.

title: Biden seeks nearly $100 billion in emergency disaster aid after Hurricanes Helene and Milton
summary: With many Republicans campaigning on reducing federal spending, there could be some debate about portions of Biden's request, as the federal government doesn't help with every disaster. It generally gets involved only if the needs are above the ability of a community or state to handle.

title: In Sudan, Al-Naw hospital is on the front line of the civil war
summary: 'In Sudan, a total war' (6/8). Ravaged by conflict since April 2023, only 20% to 30% of the country's hospitals are operational. Al-Naw Hospital, on the outskirts of Khartoum, the remaining caregivers are doing their utmost to treat the countless civilian casualties.

title: Death of Charles Dumont, sentimental crooner and composer of songs for Edith Piaf and Dalida
summary: The career of the singer, author of numerous piano romances enhanced by violins, was launched by the song 'Non, Je ne Regrette Rien,' written for 'La Môme.'

title: French farmers demonstrate against EU-Mercosur free trade agreement
summary: President Emmanuel Macron and Prime Minister Michel Barnier spoke out against the trade treaty with South American countries. But they failed to calm the anger of farmers.

title: 'Dune: Prophecy': The exercise of power in a galactic convent
summary: Set 100 centuries before the events recounted in Denis Villeneuve's films, this mystical and political series finds its way between respect for the text and originality.

title: Biden authorizes Ukraine to use long-range missiles to strike deep into Russian territory
summary: Washington has finally ceded to a request Kyiv has been making for months: authorization to use ATACMS missiles, which can reach a target almost 300 kilometers away.

title: Ukraine on the defensive, both militarily and diplomatically
summary: Under heavy Russian bombardment, Ukraine is worried about having to negotiate from a position of weakness. Kyiv's request to use long-range ATACMS missiles to aim at military targets deep inside Russian territory was approved by Joe Biden.

title: Condom use is declining among young people
summary: Under-30s are most at risk of transmitting sexually transmitted infections. And yet, according to the latest survey by Inserm and ANRS, condom use during the first intercourse fell between 2019 and 2023.

title: Charles Dumont, composer of Edith Piaf's 'Non, je ne regrette rien,' dies at 95
summary: A trumpeter by training, Dumont's career transformed when he convinced Edith Piaf to perform one of his compositions, after she had turned him down several times.

title: French far right steps ups threats of bringing down government
summary: A close ally of Marine Le Pen called for a motion of no confidence in case the government uses a constitutional tool to pass the budget without a vote.

title: Paris journalism school taken over by billionaire media owners
summary: Bernard Arnault, Vincent Bolloré and Rodolphe Saadé are among the tycoons who have bought out the Ecole Supérieure de Journalisme in Paris.

title: In Argentina, Macron pays tribute to dictatorship's victims, sending message to Milei
summary: Victims' families are concerned about the dismantling of remembrance policies by the far-right president's government.

title: In Argentina, the difficult dialogue between Macron and Milei
summary: Javier Milei, the first foreign leader to meet Donald Trump since his election, hosted Emmanuel Macron on Sunday, as Paris and Buenos Aires clash on major issues, from the fight against global warming to the EU-Mercosur free-trade treaty.

title: Strike at SNCF: railway workers fight against the "balkanization" of the company
summary: The railway unions are calling for a strike on Thursday and are planning a further strike in December. They are denouncing the break-up of the company into private subsidiaries and preparing for wage negotiations, but are finding it difficult to mobilize.

title: 'Talking drum' to return to Côte d'Ivoire as French government drags on restitution law
summary: The Ayôkwé Djidji will be exposed in its home country, but France has yet to pass legislation allowing for it to be formally restituted.

title: 'Trump's election could be a wake-up call for Europe, or accelerate its decline'
summary: The EU needs to come up with a response to the threat posed to the global economy by US protectionism and demonstrate that it is capable of turning this risk into an opportunity, argues Le Monde columnist Stéphane Lauer.

title: Israeli airstrike hits central Beirut near key government buildings and embassies
summary: Since late September, Israel has dramatically escalated its bombardment of Lebanon, vowing to severely weaken the Iranian-backed Hezbollah militant group. The US has been working on a cease-fire proposal that would remove Israeli ground forces from Lebanon and push Hezbollah forces far from the Israeli border.

title: Trump's economic policy: How Elon Musk is trying to influence key appointments
summary: As the battle rages behind the scenes for the post of Treasury Secretary, the first officials appointed by the president-elect to steer his future energy and trade policy are all hardliners.

title: Democratic Arizona governor says she'll work with Trump on border security if it won't harm families
summary: Hobbs, who said border security is not a 'Republican or Democrat issue' and will work with 'anyone' to keep the border safe, traveled to the Arizona-Mexico border on Monday to praise her state's National Guard work helping crack down on smuggling fentanyl into the US through Nogales, where more than half of border seizures of the drug are made.

title: Brazil seeks to break Starlink's monopoly
summary: The country's growing dependence on Elon Musk's satellite internet service provider is worrying the Brazilian government, which is already at odds with the tycoon over his social network X.

title: The Republican metamorphosis of Usha Vance, future second lady
summary: A highly educated lawyer, the wife of incoming Vice President JD Vance first spent time in Democratic circles before following her husband to the Republican Party in 2022. Her political turnaround mirrors the evolution of the vote in her Indian community of origin.

title: Patrick Artus: 'France or the US – which model do we prefer?'
summary: The dilemma between equity and efficiency is the subject of divergent political choices on both sides of the Atlantic, the economist said in his column.

title: The Pelicot rape trial is causing introspection and division among men: 'Honestly, we don't know where to stand anymore'
summary: For some men, the case has had an impact on their personal lives, creating a sense of unease and awareness of the systemic dimension of sexual violence. Others refuse to feel concerned by what they see as a sordid news item.

title: Hong Kong court jails 45 democracy campaigners on subversion charges
summary: The group, which included figures from across Hong Kong's once-diverse political spectrum, was charged with subversion after they held an informal poll in 2020 as part of a strategy to win a pro-democracy electoral majority.

title: France has become less attractive to foreign investors,  report says
summary: Europe's favorite destination for foreign capital since 2019, France has lost some of its appeal in the wake of the June 9 dissolution of parliament, according to EY's barometer.

title: UN peacekeepers have been bogged down in Lebanon since 1978
summary: The ongoing conflict between Israel and Hezbollah is yet another illustration of the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon's inability to fulfill its mandate.

title: At mass rape trial, Pelicots' children describe 'a family destroyed'
summary: David and Florian Pelicot and their sister Caroline Darian took to the stand at the criminal court on Monday. Their lives were upended by the discovery that their father had raped their mother, raising the question: Who else might he have abused?

title: Christophe Piquet, protesting French farmer: 'We want to make ourselves heard'
summary: Farmers' anger has been mounting for several weeks. Despite the payment of emergency aid, farmers feel that the government has not kept its promises.

title: War in the Middle East: 'To be killed trying to flee or to die besieged at home: This is the impossible choice Israel offers to Gaza's population'
summary: Isabelle Defourny, the president of MSF France, and Christopher Lockyear, the secretary-general of MSF International, call on Israel's allies to end their unconditional support for the country.

title: US allowing Ukraine to use ATACMS missiles in Russia is unlikely to change balance of power
summary: Washington's U-turn is unlikely to change the balance of power on the ground. But it does raise the question of whether Ukraine will be allowed to use French Scalp and British Storm Shadow missiles.

title: Gisèle Pelicot says 'macho, patriarchal' society must change attitude on rape
summary: The woman at the center of France's mass rape trial gave her final statement in court on November 19. Her ex-husband and dozens of other men are accused of raping her while she was drugged.

title: French farmers continue to protest against EU-Mercosur agreement
summary: The main farming unions counted '85 demonstration points' on Monday. Further action is planned for Tuesday.

title: COP29: Discussions stall and pressure mounts to save climate conference
summary: There are still major differences of opinion between the countries of the South, Western nations and China. Negotiators were counting on the G20 leaders meeting in Brazil to bring positions closer together, but no major breakthrough was achieved.

title: As Hurricane Trump approaches, experts fear an acceleration of 'doom spending'
summary: Donald Trump's election is expected to intensify over-consumption meant to offset the existential anxiety of living in an age of climate insecurity, observes Corine Lesnes, Le Monde's San Francisco correspondent.

title: At Hong Kong's major opposition trial, 45 prison sentences and the death knell for political freedom
summary: On Tuesday, the courts sentenced 45 pro-democracy activists to up to 10 years in prison for taking part in a 2020 primary after the imposition of a national security law.

title: Cable car accident in the French Alps leaves six injured
summary: A cable car carriage carrying 16 people hit the arrival station at the ski resort of Val Thorens at around 7:30 am on Tuesday morning. None of the injuries are life-threatening.

title: One last smash for Rafael Nadal before he steps off courts
summary: The legendary winner of 22 Grand Slam titles bids farewell to tennis at the Davis Cup finals in Malaga, which open with Spain against the Netherlands on Tuesday.

title: Rare great white shark spotted in the Mediterranean, off the French coast
summary: The animal was filmed by a yachtsman off the French Riviera. Scientists described it as 'superb news' for this critically endangered species.

title: François Bustillo, the highly political cardinal hoping to attract the pope to Corsica
summary: The promise of a papal visit to Corsica sounds like the reward for three years of intense activity by the bishop of Ajaccio, who has revived the island's Catholic identity and deployed his own brand of public relations, all the way to Paris.

title: Brazil arrests G20 guards over alleged 2022 Lula assassination plot
summary: Four soldiers have been arrested over an alleged plot to assassinate then President-elect Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva in a 2022 'coup.'

title: Publisher defends prize-winning French novel after Algerian victim's claims
summary: The survivor of a 1990s massacre has alleged on Algerian TV that the main character in Kamel Daoud's prize-winning book is based on her experiences.

title: With the takeover by the Arnault family, Paris FC wants to dream bigger
summary: The capital's second-biggest club, currently top of Ligue 2, intends to enter a new era with the arrival of the owners of LVMH.
